question: The percentage of overweight children in western society has increased by almost 20% in the last ten years. Discuss the causes and effects of this disturbing trend
text: In  recent years it has been indicated that 20% of juveniles are obese in  western society. In this context, I will elaborate on the causes and consequences behind the rationale and further discuss how it can be resolved.

Firstly, the reason for obesity is that the younger generation tends to get addicted to junk food easily. They tend to binge while they're occupied in other activities, such as while playing video games, watching television and so on, thus they conveniently get distracted. International fast-food chains in this evidence  appears to be Mc Donald’s, KFC, Pizza hut as their main target audience are children. These organisations advertise their food where adolescents get carried away.

,,Secondly as a consequence  obesity,  leads to other health complications and non-communicable diseases such as diabetes, cholesterol, and other diseases in their early stages. For instance, the child will have to inject insulin into his/her body or will be under medication. ,Additionally intend to do annual health check-ups and so on. Being overweight can also result in bullying adolescents in school ,for example, it has been indicated that 15% of children get bullied at school in Australia, and thereafter the child becomes psychologically affected by this. These circumstances can easily be resolved by their parents such as providing a healthy meal, and getting them engaged in physical activities, where they tend to become more active and motivated.
In conclusion, as far as I am concerned it is mandatory that their parents take  responsibility of their child's health to avoid being overweight.

error_list.error_des: The singular verb appears does not appear to agree with the plural subject chains. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
The word Mc Donald doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
It seems that conjunction use may be incorrect here.
It seems that the verb are does not agree with the subject. Consider changing the verb form.
The punctuation in ,, is incorrect. Consider changing the punctuation.
It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase Secondly. Consider adding a comma.
The indefinite article, a, may be redundant when used with the uncountable noun obesity in your sentence. Consider removing it.
It appears that you have an unnecessary comma in a compound predicate. Consider removing it.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
